Study: Respiratory virus shedding in exhaled breath and efficacy of face masks
Excerpt: We also demonstrated the efficacy of surgical masks to reduce coronavirus detection and viral copies in large respiratory droplets and in aerosols (Table 1b). This has important implications for control of COVID-19, suggesting that surgical face masks could be used by ill people to reduce onward transmission

Excerpt: Overall masks were the best performing intervention across populations, settings and threats

Study: Association between 2019-nCoV transmission and N95 respirator use
Excerpt: In our study, we found N95 respirators, disinfection and hand washing can help to reduce the risk of 2019-nCoV infection in medical staffs
